member_organisations:
Our members include: Affiliated Managers Group, AFME, Allianz Global Investors, Barclays, Berenberg, BlackRock, BNP Paribas, BNY Mellon, Cboe Europe Columbia Threadneedle Investments, CQS, Hermes Investment Management, JP Morgan, Legal & General, Liquidnet, London Stock Exchange Group, Nomura, Virgin Money...  
 
Please visit www.newfinancial.eu for updates, or contact william.wright@newfinancial.eu
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Competition, Business and Industry, Taxation, Single market, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: Capital markets union, Brexit, gender policy, financial policy and regulation
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership: New Financial receives support in kind from D Group, an business development and professional services firm based at 23 Grafton St, London W1S 4EY.
relevant_communication:
Publication and distribution of research on European capital markets / capital markets union including:  
 
September 2017: Brexit & the City: missing the bigger picture on jobs 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/private-brexit-city-missing-bigger-picture-jobs/ 
 
July 2017: CMU 2.0: what next for capital markets union? 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/cmu-2-0-what-next-for-capital-markets-union/ 
 
April 2017: ‘What the rest of the EU thinks about Brexit & The City of London’ 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/what-the-rest-of-the-eu-thinks-about-brexit-the-city/ 
 
March 2017: Report on ‘What have the capital markets ever done for us? And how could they do it better?’ 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/report-on-what-have-the-capital-markets-ever-done-for-us-and-how-could-they-do-it-better/ 
 
February 2017: Brexit and the City: a 10-point reality check 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/brexit-and-the-city-a-10-point-reality-check/ 
 
January 2017: Everything you ever wanted to know about Brexit – but didn’t have time to read 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/everything-you-ever-wanted-to-know-about-brexit-but-didnt-have-time-to-read/ 
 
January 2017: Brexit and the City: don’t let a good crisis go to waste 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/brexit-and-the-city-dont-let-a-good-crisis-go-to-waste/ 
 
October 2016: The benefits of capital markets to high potential economies in the EU 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/report-on-the-benefits-of-capital-markets-to-high-potential-eu-economies-2/ 
 
September 2016: What do EU capital markets look like post Brexit?  
 
http://newfinancial.eu/report-on-what-do-eu-capital-markets-look-like-post-brexit/ 
 
April 2016: The potential impact of Brexit on European capital markets 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/report-on-the-potential-impact-of-brexit-on-european-capital-markets/ 
 
May 2015: Decoding capital markets union: report on the potential growth in European capital markets 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/Decoding-capital-markets-union-final-0915.pdf 
 
A signal of intent: report on diversity disclosure in European capital markets 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Diversity_disclosure_Oct2015.pdf 
 
January 2016: 'Counting every woman: gender diversity in European capital markets' 
 
http://newfinancial.eu/report-counting-every-woman-2016-gender-diversity-in-the-capital-markets/ 
 
Hosting of private events on the role and reform of capital markets in Europe.
legal_status: A social enterprise formed as a limited liability partnership
goals__remit:
New Financial is think tank and forum that believes Europe needs bigger and better capital markets to help kick start its recovery - and that this presents a huge opportunity for the industry and its customers to embrace reform, and to rethink how capital markets work.  
 
We provide a private forum for senior people with different perspectives from across the capital markets industry to come together to address collective challenges.  
 
We also produce regular papers and commentary on the industry, which are available through our website www.newfinancial.eu
